intro: Draba sarycheleki, commonly known as the Sarychev Peak Draba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species of cruciferous plants. This species is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh weather conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
